intro: Styphelia affinis, commonly known as the dwarf heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are dark green and evergreen throughout the year. Styphelia affinis thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in heathland and coastal heath communities.
